newsitem.title: USA: ASARCO expects stable lead prices in 1997/98.
newsitem.headline: ASARCO expects stable lead prices in 1997/98.

text.p: The lead market was expected to remain in slight deficit over the next two years, helping to keep prices stable, Richard de J Osborne, chairman, president and chief executive of ASARCO, said.
Osborne told analysts that the Western world lead market would see a shortfall of 18,000 tonnes this year and 16,000 tonnes in 1998, compared to a deficit of 50,000 tonnes in 1996.
Western world lead consumption was expected to grow 3.3 percent this year and about the same in 1998, with supply rising by 4.2 percent in each of the next few years.
"We expect small deficits, we don't expect the market to move into surplus," Osborne said. "We don't expect to see extreme price movements in lead during the next two years."
ASARCO produced 98,837 tonnes of lead from its own mines last year, and custom smelted further amounts.
